thread.title: Lyon's 348-yard night leads Moravia past Notre Dame
thread.title_full: Lyon's 348-yard night leads Moravia past Notre Dame

title: Lyon's 348-yard night leads Moravia past Notre Dame
text:
Lyon's 348-yard night leads Moravia past Notre Dame Andrew Legare, alegare@stargazette.com | @SGAndrewLegare 11:02 p.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Senior scores five touchdowns in 39-13 Class D quarterfinal victory Buy Photo Notre Dame's Dimitrius Stanley grasps at Moravia's Jared Lyon Friday night in the second quarter. (Photo: KELLY GAMPEL / Staff Photo) Buy Photo CONNECT 11 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
You might say Jared Lyon roared back in the rematch against Elmira Notre Dame. 
After the Crusaders held the Moravia star to 69 yards in a regular-season victory, Lyon countered with one of the best games an opponent has ever had against Notre Dame on Friday night. The senior carried the ball 43 times for an unofficial 348 yards and five touchdowns as the Blue Devils pulled away for a 39-13 victory in a Section 4 Class D quarterfinal at Brewer Memorial Stadium. 
Lyon also had an interception to snuff a Crusaders drive at the end of the first half in a brilliant encore to last weekâ€™s school-record 347-yard rushing effort against Spencer-Van Etten. He has rushed for nearly 1,800 yards this season. 
Lyon gave the Blue Devils (5-3) the lead for good, 19-13, when he ran in from 14 yards out with 1 minute, 15 seconds remaining in the first half. He also had touchdown runs of 3, 10, 14 and 70 yards. 
Moravia earned a semifinal berth against Deposit/Hancock on Oct. 31 at Binghamton Alumni Stadium as part of a Class D doubleheader. Deposit/Hancock was a 66-12 quarterfinal winner over Groton on Friday. 
Notre Dame finished the season with a 5-3 record. Buy Photo Notre Dame hosted the Moravia Blue Devils Friday night four a varsity football match. KELLY GAMPEL / Staff Photo Fullscreen Buy Photo Notre Dame junior Tim Davis successfully catches the football near the end zone Friday night in a contest against Moravia. KELLY GAMPEL / Staff Photo
